intro: Anetanthus villosus, commonly known as the hairy anemone, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other similar species. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Anetanthus villosus is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
